com.phunware.alerts

Class PwAlertsRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.phunware.alerts.PwAlertsRegister

  • public final class PwAlertsRegister
extends Object
    Use this to register, unregister and initialize the Alert service.
    When the Alerts module is first installed (either as a fresh install or as the first time running the Alerts module), a call is made to register the device for push alerts. Registration can be manually triggered using register(Context) and unregister(Context). Both should be called asynchronously and outside of the UI thread.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public static void register(android.content.Context context)
        Use this to initialize the registration process. This will not re-register or send any duplicate requests. If the app is already registered, then a message will be broadcast using action BROADCAST_MESSAGE_ACTION with the message stored under the key Utils#BROADCAST_MESSAGE_KEY.



        To unregister, use unregister(Context).

        Parameters:
        context - Context The application context.

      • hasRegistered

        public static boolean hasRegistered(android.content.Context context)
        Determine if the app has been registered to receive alerts.
        Parameters:
        context - Context The application context.
        Returns:
        true if the device is registered, false if not.

      • sendPositiveClick

        public static void sendPositiveClick(android.content.Context context,
                                     String pid)
        Send a positive click to the server when an incoming alert message has been clicked. A positive click means that an incoming alert message has been viewed. This isn't required but is suggested.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to work with.
        pid - The alert's PID. The PID can be found in the alert's extras when an alert is received from the GCMIntentService class. PwAlertExtras.getDataPID()

      • unregister

        public static void unregister(android.content.Context context)
        Unregistering the Alerts service. Register with register(Context).
        Parameters:
        context - Context The application context.

      • applicationLaunch

        protected static void applicationLaunch(android.content.Context context)
        This should be called on start up AlertsModule.onCoreInitialized(android.content.Context, boolean, boolean) AlertsModule.OnCoreInitialized()}. This method will automatically opt in alerts during the first install. It will also perform registration retries on failed attempts and re-register if there is an updated app.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to work with.

      • getStartCalls

        protected static String getStartCalls(android.content.Context context)

      • hasRegisteredGCM

        protected static boolean hasRegisteredGCM(android.content.Context context)
        Determine if GCM has been registered.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to work with.
        Returns:
        true if registered, false if not registered.

      • setRegisterAlerts

        protected static void setRegisterAlerts(android.content.Context context,
                                        String token,
                                        boolean register)
                                 throws IOException,
                                        EncryptionException,
                                        NoInternetException
        Call this to perform a register or unregister call. Will perform a network call. Make sure to call this outside of the UI thread.
        Parameters:
        context - Context The application context.
        register - Set to true for register, false for unregister.
        Throws:
        IOException
        EncryptionException
        NoInternetException

      • clearSharedPrefsStartCalls

        protected static void clearSharedPrefsStartCalls(android.content.Context context)
        Once a register, unregister, or re-register process is completed, we will then clear the registration state with this method. We don't want to keep the state on application launch. Otherwise, it will attempt to retry registration.
        Parameters:
        context -
